info.title: Voucherify API
info.description: Voucherify promotion engine REST API. Please see https://docs.voucherify.io/docs for more details.

post.description:
<!-- theme: danger -->
> ❗️ Deprecated  
>
> This endpoint represents the deprecated version of the API responsible for promotion tier redemption, and we do not recommend using it. The new [Stackable Discounts API](ref:validate-stacked-discounts) introduces additional features and improvements while maintaining backward compatibility, including applying a combination of coupon codes and promotion tiers. Developers are encouraged to migrate to the latest version to take advantage of the latest enhancements and bug fixes. No updates will be provided to the deprecated endpoint. 

To verify whether the promotion tier discount can be applied to an order. This method is designed for server side integration which means that it is accessible only through private keys.

requestBody.description: Provide the customer and order context.

200.description: Returns validation result in `valid` key of the promotion tier object. Returns `true` if the promotion tier rules and validation rules are satisfied given the request body parameters. Returns `false` if the data provided in the payload does not meet validation rules or promotion tier requirements.

value.reason: redemption does not match validation rules

error.message: redemption does not match validation rules
error.details: Promotion Tier cannot be redeemed because of violated validation rules: val_eqSA1dXOv491

value.name: Add missing order items

6_req_validate_promotion_tier.title: Validate Promotion Tier Request Body
6_req_validate_promotion_tier.description: Request schema model for validating a promotion using **POST** `v1/promotions/tiers/{tierId}/validation`.

metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **redemption** metadata validation rules to be satisfied. The validation runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Advanced_ → _Redemption metadata satisfy_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Attributes match_ → _REDEMPTION METADATA_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

6_res_validate_promotion_tier.title: Validate Promotion Tier Response Body
6_res_validate_promotion_tier.description: Response schema model for validating a promotion using **POST** `v1/promotions/tiers/{tierId}/validation`.

6_req_validate_voucher_customer_id.title: Customer ID
6_req_validate_voucher_customer_id.description: You can pass the unique customer ID that was assigned by Voucherify.

id.description: The ID of an existing customer that will be linked to redemption in this request.

6_req_validate_voucher_customer_source_i.title: Customer Source ID
6_req_validate_voucher_customer_source_i.description: You can send the source ID that you used to create the customer in Voucherify.

source_id.description: A unique identifier of the customer who validates a voucher. It can be a customer ID or email from a CRM system, database, or a third-party service. If you also pass a customer ID (unique ID assigned by Voucherify), the source ID will be ignored.

9_req_create_customer.title: Customer
9_req_create_customer.description: This is an object containing information about the customer.

source_id.description:
The merchant's customer ID if it is different from the Voucherify customer ID. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a customer ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service. 

Please note that if you would like your data to sync based on the `source_id` of the customer, you need to define the `source_id` upfront. You will not be able to change or update the `source_id` later on.

description.description: An arbitrary string that you can attach to a customer object.

phone.description: Customer's phone number.  This parameter is mandatory when you try to send out codes to customers via an SMS channel.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a customer. The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the customer. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format. This metadata can be used for validating whether the customer qualifies for a discount or it can be used in building customer segments.

6_req_validate_voucher_order_id.title: Order ID
6_req_validate_voucher_order_id.description: You can pass the unique order ID that was assigned by Voucherify.

id.description: Unique ID assigned by Voucherify of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

6_req_validate_voucher_order_source_id.title: Order Source ID
6_req_validate_voucher_order_source_id.description: You can send the source ID that you used to create the order in Voucherify.

source_id.description: Unique source ID of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

allOf.title: Order Customer And Referrer Ids Objects

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

6_res_validate_promotion_tier_true.title: Promotion Tier Valid
6_res_validate_promotion_tier_true.description: Response schema model for valid promotion tier when validating a promotion using **POST** `v1/promotions/tiers/{tierId}/validation`.

valid.description: Indicates whether the promotion is valid within the context of the parameters provided in the request body and filters in the query parameters.

id.description: Unique promotion tier ID.

banner.description: Text to be displayed to your customers on your website.

discount.description: Contains information about the discount to be applied to the order.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive* before this date.

expiration_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier expires in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive* after this date.

id.description: Unique promotion tier ID.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive* before this date.

expiration_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive* after this date.

active.description:
A flag indicating whether the campaign is active or not active. A campaign can be disabled even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* campaign
- `false` indicates an *inactive* campaign

object.description: The type of the object represented by the campaign object. This object stores information about the campaign.

hierarchy.description: The promotions hierarchy defines the order in which the discounts from different tiers will be applied to a customer's order. If a customer qualifies for discounts from more than one tier, discounts will be applied in the order defined in the hierarchy.

discount_amount.description: The calculated discount amount based on the discount type and effect.

applied_discount_amount.description: The effective discount amount that would be applied to the order.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the promotion tier. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a promotion tier object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the promotion tier in a structured format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the promotion tier.

6_res_validate_promotion_tier_false.description: Response schema model for a non-valid promotion tier when validating a promotion using **POST** `v1/promotions/tiers/{tierId}/validation`.
6_res_validate_promotion_tier_false.title: Promotion Tier Not Valid

valid.description: Response schema for a voucher that is not valid.

reason.description: System generated cause for the voucher being invalid in the context of the provided parameters.

error.description: Detailed failure cause for the invalid voucher if the reason has a translation defined in the Dashboard → Project Settings → Error Messages.

id.description: Promotion tier ID.

banner.description: Text to be displayed to your customers on your website.

discount.description: Contains information about the discount to be applied to the order.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive* before this date.

expiration_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier expires in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive* after this date.

id.description: Unique promotion tier ID.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive* before this date.

expiration_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive* after this date.

active.description:
A flag indicating whether the campaign is active or not active. A campaign can be disabled even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* campaign
- `false` indicates an *inactive* campaign

object.description: The type of the object represented by the campaign object. This object stores information about the campaign.

hierarchy.description: The promotions hierarchy defines the order in which the discounts from different tiers will be applied to a customer's order. If a customer qualifies for discounts from more than one tier, discounts will be applied in the order defined in the hierarchy.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the promotion tier. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a promotion tier object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the promotion tier in a structured format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the promotion tier.

id.description: Unique ID assigned by Voucherify of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.
The ID of an existing customer.

source_id.description: A unique identifier of the customer who validates a voucher. It can be a customer ID or email from a CRM system, database, or a third-party service. If you also pass a customer ID (unique ID assigned by Voucherify), the source ID will be ignored.

6_res_applicable_to_object.title: Included  Items
6_res_applicable_to_object.description: Contains list of items that qualify in the scope of the discount. These are definitions of included products, SKUs, and product collections. These can be discounted.

data.description: Contains array of items to which the discount can apply.

total.description: Total number of objects defining included products, SKUs, or product collections.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of included objects.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about included products, SKUs, or product collections in a dictionary.

6_res_inapplicable_to_object.title: Excluded Items
6_res_inapplicable_to_object.description: Contains list of items that **do not** qualify in the scope of the discount. These are definitions of excluded products, SKUs, and product collections. These **CANNOT** be discounted.

data.description: Contains array of items to which the discount cannot apply.

total.description: Total number of objects defining excluded products, SKUs, or product collections.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of excluded objects.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about excluded products, SKUs, or product collections in a dictionary.

6_obj_order_object.title: Order object
6_obj_order_object.description: This is an object representing an order with calculated discounts applied using the voucher code.

6_res_validate_voucher_discount_amount.title: Amount Discount
6_res_validate_voucher_discount_amount.description: This is an object representing the discount that the customer would receive in the context of the provided request body parameters. If the discount is calculated based on a formula, this object will return either the discount calculated based on the formula or the fallback value.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

amount_off.description: Amount taken off the subtotal of a price. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000.

6_res_validate_voucher_discount_percent.title: Percent Discount
6_res_validate_voucher_discount_percent.description: This is an object representing the discount that the customer would receive in the context of the provided request body parameters. If the discount is calculated based on a formula, this object will return either the discount calculated based on the formula or the fallback value.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

percent_off.description: The percent discount that the customer will receive.

amount_limit.description: Upper limit allowed to be applied as a discount. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $6 maximum discount is written as 600.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount was calculated using a formula.

6_res_validate_voucher_discount_fixed.title: Fixed Discount
6_res_validate_voucher_discount_fixed.description: This is an object representing the discount that the customer would receive in the context of the provided request body parameters. If the discount is calculated based on a formula, this object will return either the discount calculated based on the formula or the fallback value. A fixed discounts sets a fixed total on cart or item(s) and then calculates the discount to apply.

effect.description:
Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.    
    
| **Effect** | **Definition** |
|---|---|
| **APPLY_TO_ORDER** | Sets the order total amount to the value of the fixed amount. The discount value is calculated during the redemption as it's a difference between the total amount of the customer's order and the fixed amount. |
| **APPLY_TO_ITEMS** | Sets a new price on items. The total discount amount is calculated during the redemption and it's a difference between the initial item price and the fixed amount. |

fixed_amount.description: Sets a fixed value for an order total or the item price. The value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000. If the fixed amount is calculated by the formula, i.e. the `fixed_amount_formula` parameter is present in the fixed amount definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. As a result, if the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the fixed value.

6_res_validate_voucher_discount_unit.title: Unit Discount, single item
6_res_validate_voucher_discount_unit.description: This is an object representing the discount that the customer would receive in the context of the provided request body parameters. If the discount is calculated based on a formula, this object will return either the discount calculated based on the formula or the fallback value.

6_res_validate_voucher_discount_unit_mul.title: Unit Discount, multiple items
6_res_validate_voucher_discount_unit_mul.description: This is an object representing the discount that the customer would receive in the context of the provided request body parameters. If the discount is calculated based on a formula, this object will return either the discount calculated based on the formula or the fallback value.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

6_res_validate_voucher_discount_shipping.title: Shipping Discount
6_res_validate_voucher_discount_shipping.description: This is an object representing the discount that the customer would receive in the context of the provided request body parameters. If the discount is calculated based on a formula, this object will return either the discount calculated based on the formula or the fallback value.

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order.

unit_off.description: Number of units to be granted a full value discount.

id.description: Unique shipping "product" ID, assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: "Product's" source ID.

Category.title: Category
Category.description: This is an object representing a category.

id.description: Unique category ID assigned by Voucherify.

hierarchy.description: Category hierarchy. Categories with lower hierarchy are processed before categories with higher hierarchy value.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the category.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the category was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the category was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

key.description: Short string describing the kind of error which occurred.

message.description: A human-readable message providing a short description of the error.

details.description: A human-readable message providing more details about the error.

request_id.description: This ID is useful when troubleshooting and/or finding the root cause of an error response by our support team.

resource_id.description: Unique resource ID that can be used in another endpoint to get more details.

error.description: Includes additional information about the error.

message.description: The message configured by the user in a validation rule.

source_id.description: Unique source ID of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

amount.description: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00) representing the total amount of the order. This is the sum of the order items' amounts.

initial_amount.description: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00) representing the total amount of the order. This is the sum of the order items' amounts.

discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-level discounts applied to the order. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

items.description: Array of items applied to the order. It can include up to 500 items.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to an order. It can be useful for storing additional information about the order in a structured format. It can be used to define business validation rules or discount formulas.

description.description: An arbitrary string that you can attach to a customer object.

phone.description: Customer's phone number. This parameter is mandatory when you try to send out codes to customers via an SMS channel.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a customer. The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the customer. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format. This metadata can be used for validating whether the customer qualifies for a discount or it can be used in building customer segments.

6_res_product_collection.title: Product Collection
6_res_product_collection.description: Contains definition for a product collection.

object.description: This object stores information about the product collection.

id.description: Unique product collection ID assigned by Voucherify.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

6_res_product_collection_unit.title: Product Collection for Unit Discount
6_res_product_collection_unit.description: Contains definition for a product collection.

object.description: This object stores information about the product collection.

id.description: Unique product collection ID assigned by Voucherify.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

quantity_limit.description: The maximum number of units allowed to be discounted per order line item.

aggregated_quantity_limit.description: The maximum number of units allowed to be discounted combined across all matched order line items.

6_res_product_collection_fixed_amount.title: Product Collection for Fixed Amount Discount
6_res_product_collection_fixed_amount.description: Contains definition for a product collection.

object.description: This object stores information about the product collection.

id.description: Unique product collection ID assigned by Voucherify.

price.description: New fixed price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 price is written as 1000. In case of the fixed price being calculated by the formula, i.e. the `price_formula` parameter is present in the fixed price definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. Such that in a case where the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the fixed price.

price_formula.description: Formula used to calculate the discounted price of an item.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

object.description: This object stores information about the product.

id.description: Unique product ID assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The product ID from your inventory system.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

object.description: This object stores information about the product.

id.description: Unique product ID assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The product ID from your inventory system.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

quantity_limit.description: The maximum number of units allowed to be discounted per order line item.

aggregated_quantity_limit.description: The maximum number of units allowed to be discounted combined across all matched order line items.

object.description: This object stores information about the product.

id.description: Unique product ID assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The product ID from your inventory system.

price.description: New fixed price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 price is written as 1000. In case of the fixed price being calculated by the formula, i.e. the `price_formula` parameter is present in the fixed price definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. Such that in a case where the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the fixed price.

price_formula.description: Formula used to calculate the discounted price of an item.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

6_res_sku.description: Contains definition for a product variant.

object.description: This object stores information about the product variant.

id.description: Unique SKU ID assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The source ID from your inventory system.

product_id.description: Parent product's unique ID assigned by Voucherify.

product_source_id.description: Parent product's source ID from your inventory system.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

6_res_sku_unit_fixed_amount.description: Contains definition for a product variant.

source_id.description: The source ID from your inventory system.

In case of the fixed price being calculated by the formula, i.e. the `price_formula` parameter is present in the fixed price definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. Such that in a case where the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the fixed price.

6_res_product_collection_excluded.description: Contains definition for a product collection.

id.description: Unique product collection ID assigned by Voucherify.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

id.description: Unique product ID assigned by Voucherify.

6_res_sku_excluded.description: Contains definition for a product variant.

6_obj_order_object_apply_to_order.title: Order object - Effect: Apply to order
6_obj_order_object_apply_to_order.description: This is an object representing an order with calculated discounts applied using the voucher code.

id.description: Unique order ID, assigned by Voucherify. This parameter is returned only if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body.

source_id.description: The merchant's order ID if it is different from the Voucherify order ID. It is really useful in case of integration between multiple systems. It can be an order ID from CRM, database or 3rd party service. This parameter is returned only if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format. This parameter is returned only if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format. This parameter is returned only if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body.

status.description: Order status. This parameter is returned if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body or if you send the request body parameter when defining an order in the request body. This parameter can be passed but it's not required for validation at all. It's used in the redemption process. Normally after the redemption is done, the order is automatically to a `PAID` status. To avoid such default behaviour, the user can pass any of the other status options and it will be set the order status after the redemption instead of the default `PAID`.

amount.description: Order amount before applying any discount.

discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-level discounts applied to the order.

total_amount.description:
Order amount after applying all the discounts.  
`total_amount` = `amount` - `total_discount_amount`

applied_discount_amount.description: This field shows the order-level discount applied.

total_applied_discount_amount.description: This field sums up all order-level discounts applied to the order.

items.description: Array of order items that have been applied to the order. Each order item can show the effects of particular discounts on the item-level.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the `order_item`.

product_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

sku_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

quantity.description: Quantity of the item in the cart.

amount.description: Represents a total pre-discount amount of order item (`price` * `quantity`).

price.description: Unit price of an item. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

subtotal_amount.description:
Final order item amount after the applied item-level discount.  If there are no item-level discounts applied, this item is equal to the `amount`.   
`subtotal_amount`=`amount`-`discount_amount`

product.description: This object stores more information about the related product.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: A unique product identifier from your inventory system.

price.description: Unit price of a product. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

sku.description: This object stores more information about the related SKU.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: A unique SKU identifier from your inventory system.

price.description: Unit price of a SKU. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the order. A set of key/value pairs that are att to an order object. Stores additional information about the order in a structured format.

customer.description: Object containing information about the customer that is making the purchase.

id.description: Unique customer identifier of the customer making the purchase. The ID is assigned by Voucherify.

object.description: Type of object represented by the `customer` object.

referrer.description: Object containing information about the referrer.

id.description: Unique referrer ID, who referred the customer making the purchase.

object.description: Type of object represented by the `referrer` object.

customer_id.description: Unique customer identifier of the customer making the purchase. The ID is assigned by Voucherify.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the `order`.

6_obj_order_object_apply_to_items.title: Order object - Effect: Apply to items
6_obj_order_object_apply_to_items.description: This is an object representing an order with calculated discounts applied using the voucher code.

id.description: Unique order ID, assigned by Voucherify. This parameter is returned only if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body.

source_id.description: The merchant's order ID if it is different from the Voucherify order ID. It is really useful in case of integration between multiple systems. It can be an order ID from CRM, database or 3rd party service. This parameter is returned only if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format. This parameter is returned only if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format. This parameter is returned only if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body.

status.description: Order status. This parameter is returned if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body or if you send the request body parameter when defining an order in the request body. This parameter can be passed but it's not required for validation at all. It's used in the redemption process. Normally after the redemption is done, the order is automatically to a `PAID` status. To avoid such default behaviour, the user can pass any of the other status options and it will be set the order status after the redemption instead of the default `PAID`.

amount.description: Order amount before applying any discount.

items_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all product-specific discounts applied.  
`sum(items, i => i.discount_amount)`

total_discount_amount.description: Sum of all product-specific discounts applied.

total_amount.description:
Order amount after applying all the discounts.  
`total_amount` = `amount` - `total_discount_amount`

items_applied_discount_amount.description: Product-specifc discounts applied to all the items.

total_applied_discount_amount.description: Product-specific discounts applied in the order.

items.description: Array of order items that have been applied to the order. Each order item can show the effects of particular discounts on the item-level.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the `order_item`.

product_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

sku_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

quantity.description: Quantity of the item in the cart.

amount.description: Represents a total pre-discount amount of order item (`price` * `quantity`).

discount_amount.description: The item-level discount applied to the item.

applied_discount_amount.description: The item-level discount applied to the item.

price.description: Unit price of an item. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

subtotal_amount.description:
Final order item amount after the applied item-level discount.  If there are no item-level discounts applied, this item is equal to the `amount`.   
`subtotal_amount`=`amount`-`discount_amount`

product.description: This object stores more information about the related product.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: A unique product identifier from your inventory system.

price.description: Unit price of a product. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

sku.description: This object stores more information about the related SKU.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: A unique SKU identifier from your inventory system.

price.description: Unit price of a SKU. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the order. A set of key/value pairs that are att to an order object. Stores additional information about the order in a structured format.

customer.description: Object containing information about the customer that is making the purchase.

id.description: Unique customer identifier of the customer making the purchase. The ID is assigned by Voucherify.

object.description: Type of object represented by the `customer` object.

referrer.description: Object containing information about the referrer.

id.description: Unique referrer ID, who referred the customer making the purchase.

object.description: Type of object represented by the `referrer` object.

customer_id.description: Unique customer identifier of the customer making the purchase. The ID is assigned by Voucherify.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the `order`.

6_res_validate_voucher_discount_unit_pro.title: Unit Discount, Product
6_res_validate_voucher_discount_unit_pro.description: This is an object representing the discount that the customer would receive in the context of the provided request body parameters. If the discount is calculated based on a formula, this object will return either the discount calculated based on the formula or the fallback value.

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order.

unit_off.description: Number of units to be granted a full value discount.

unit_type.description: The product deemed as free, chosen from product inventory (e.g. time, items).

id.description: Unique product ID, assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: Product's source ID.

6_res_validate_voucher_discount_unit_sku.title: Unit Discount, SKU
6_res_validate_voucher_discount_unit_sku.description: This is an object representing the discount that the customer would receive in the context of the provided request body parameters. If the discount is calculated based on a formula, this object will return either the discount calculated based on the formula or the fallback value.

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order.

unit_off.description: Number of units to be granted a full value discount.

unit_type.description: The product variant deemed as free, chosen from product inventory (e.g. time, items).

id.description: Unique SKU ID, assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: Product variant's source ID.

product.description: Contains information about the parent product.

id.description: Unique parent product ID, assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: Source ID of parent product.

6_res_validate_voucher_discount_unit_pro.title: Product Item
6_res_validate_voucher_discount_unit_pro.description: This is an object representing the discount that the customer would receive in the context of the provided request body parameters. If the discount is calculated based on a formula, this object will return either the discount calculated based on the formula or the fallback value.

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order.

unit_off.description: Number of units to be granted a full value discount.

unit_type.description: The product deemed as free, chosen from product inventory (e.g. time, items).

id.description: Unique product ID, assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: Product's source ID.

6_res_validate_voucher_discount_unit_sku.title: SKU Item
6_res_validate_voucher_discount_unit_sku.description: This is an object representing the discount that the customer would receive in the context of the provided request body parameters. If the discount is calculated based on a formula, this object will return either the discount calculated based on the formula or the fallback value.

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order.

unit_off.description: Number of units to be granted a full value discount.

unit_type.description: The product variant deemed as free, chosen from product inventory (e.g. time, items).

id.description: Unique SKU ID, assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: Product variant's source ID.

product.description: Contains information about the parent product.

id.description: Unique parent product ID, assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: Source ID of parent product.

sku_id.description: Unique identifier of the SKU. It is assigned by Voucherify.

product_id.description: Unique identifier of the product. It is assigned by Voucherify.

related_object.description: Used along with the source_id property, can be set to either sku or product.

source_id.description: The merchant's product/SKU ID (if it is different from the Voucherify product/SKU ID). It is useful in the integration between multiple systems. It can be an ID from an eCommerce site, a database, or a third-party service.

quantity.description: The quantity of the particular item in the cart.

initial_quantity.description: A positive integer in the smallest unit quantity representing the total amount of the order; this is the sum of the order items' quantity.

amount.description: The total amount of the order item (price * quantity).

discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-item-level discounts applied to the order.

initial_amount.description: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00) representing the total amount of the order. This is the sum of the order items' amounts.

price.description: Unit price of an item. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

product.description: An object containing details of the related product.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The merchant's product ID (if it is different than Voucherify's product ID). It is really useful in case of integration between multiple systems. It can be an ID from an eCommerce site, a database or a 3rd party service.

override.description: The override set to `true` is used to store the product information in the system. If the product does not exist, it will be created with a source_id; if it does exist, the provided values for the name, price, and metadata will replace those already stored in the system. Override works only for endpoints that create an order in the database.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a product. It can be useful for storing additional information about the product in a structured format. It can be used to create product collections.

price.description: Product price. A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

sku.description: An object containing details of the related SKU.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The merchant's SKU ID (if it is different than Voucherify's SKU ID). It is really useful in case of integration between multiple systems. It can be an ID from an eCommerce site, a database or a 3rd party service.

override.description: The override set to `true` is used to store the product information in the system. If the product does not exist, it will be created with a source_id; if it does exist, the provided values for the name, price, and metadata will replace those already stored in the system.

price.description: SKU price. A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to an order item. It can be useful for storing additional information about the order item in a structured format. It can be used to create product collections.

A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to an order item. It can be useful for storing additional information about the order item in a structured format. It can be used to define business validation rules.
